Comment: In general, it's financially advantageous for most clients in civil suits to settle. Trials are expensive. They take a lot of time for lawyers, paralegals, and other staff. It requires a lot of legwork and filing paperwork. And then you leave it up to a jury (or sometimes a judge) to make a decision.  It's almost always cheaper to settle a civil lawsuit. Your lawyer is supposed to look out for your best interest, which includes your financial position.  In this case it appears that the law firm thought they would lose clients faster (and thus lose money) by fighting the government than by settling.   The real focus here should be that the government put a private law firm in that position in the first place, not how the law firm responded.
